subject: p13978244
Findings: Lungs are well expanded. Blunting of the right costophrenic angle is unchanged and may reflect chronic pleural thickening. Retrocardiac opacity is likely due to Bochdalek hernia on previous CT. Cardiomediastinal silhouette is otherwise unremarkable.
Impression: Retrocardiac opacity is likely due to atelectasis and posterior pleural fat/small Bochdalek hernia seen on CT of the chest from. Please see subsequently obtained CTA chest for further details.
